summary: So lately i've been seeing these "Spider-sonas" well for the first time ever I can say... I BEAT YA'LL TO IT, in 2015 I got a...
body: So lately i’ve been seeing these “Spider-sonas” well for the first time ever I can say… I BEAT YA’LL TO IT, in 2015 I got a spider-man hoodie and a ridiculous idea of an alternate spider hero whose only costume was said novelty hoodie. Thought ya’ll enjoy the trip down my memory lane :P

summary: So I entered @brakken-spideyverse 's contest to makeover a Spidey character and decided to do everyone's favorite fishbowl head,...
body:
So I entered @brakken-spideyverse ’s contest to makeover a Spidey character and decided to do everyone’s favorite fishbowl head, Mysterio.

I thought I would share my design. A couple things (cause my drawing skill is a little lacking): his belt has the eye symbol in diamonds across it, the swirls on his arms have runes over them and his mask is reflective, similar to the fishbowl.

summary: Unpopular opinion but Spider-Man characters who should die of old age already: The Vulture  The Black Fox Aunt May (I love you,...
body:
Unpopular opinion but Spider-Man characters who should die of old age already:

  • The Vulture
  • The Black Fox
  • Aunt May (I love you, but it’s the truth)

Just… so much of their arcs have revolved around old age, illness, deterioration and death, at this point leaving them alive is cheap. Admittedly, I’m speaking as someone who’s still reading the early 90′s era, but there’s people who look at Aunt May possibly having cancer right now, in 2019, and going “yeah, I don’t feel like it, I’ll just come back when this arc’s done…” (Btw, this is not about people who get uncomfortable or triggered by cancer storylines, it’s about those who are bored.) Although I’d have preferred it if Peter would tell her he’s Spider-Man and have sometime with her knowing before she bought it, now that they’ve started this storyline, the only acceptable move will be to kill her off. Illness arcs just barely have value with her anymore.

With the Black Fox (he might be dead already) and the Vulture, most if not all of their characters revolve around being old but “still having it”. It’s been over ten years of strenuous activity, probably inadequate care in prison and getting beat up, they should be dead already.

summary: Some Oscar Isaac Spider-Verse trivia for you...
body:
Some Oscar Isaac Spider-Verse trivia for you…

I attended a screening of Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse last night - it was AMAZING! Best animated film (and superhero film) I’ve ever seen. I highly recommend it.

One of the film’s directors (there are three of them), Rodney Rothman, did a Q&A after the screening, so I asked him about Oscar’s scene. And this is what he divulged (mild spoiler ahead):

The concept for that coda (post-credits) scene wasn’t even agreed upon until October 2018, only two months before the film was to be released. They were under such a time constraint that Oscar had to send in his performance via FaceTime. That’s right - he literally had to dial in his performance (I’m guessing most likely from either England or Jordan - wherever he was for Star Wars duties at the time).

Oscar was allowed to improvise parts of his scene, and because this was such a last-minute addition to the film, the filmmakers ended up animating the whole thing in Scratch.

*NOTE: The Q&A for this screening was recorded, and it will be available via podcast soon. I’ll post it when it becomes available, in case anyone wants to listen to it.

**P.S. - If you want to read the post-credits scene (or the entire screenplay), you can access it through the link below.

summary: Ok, so, holy shit! I just saw Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse and I’m just— wow! I don’t have words to describe how amazing it...
body: Ok, so, holy shit! I just saw Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse and I’m just— wow! I don’t have words to describe how amazing it was. The animation was insane, the voice acting was phenomenal, and the characters were so unique and quirky too! This will be without a doubt my favourite animated film of all time!

reblog.comment: Ok, so, holy shit! I just saw Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse and I’m just— wow! I don’t have words to describe how amazing it was. The animation was insane, the voice acting was phenomenal, and the characters were so unique and quirky too! This will be without a doubt my favourite animated film of all time!

The animation was insane, the voice acting was phenomenal, and the characters were so unique and quirky too! This will be without a doubt my favourite animated film of all time!

summary:
Hey Marvel/Sony, can we please get a Turn Off The Dark reference in the Spiderverse sequel? 
Earth 11714 Peter is just as valid...
body:
Hey Marvel/Sony, can we please get a Turn Off The Dark reference in the Spiderverse sequel?

Earth 11714 Peter is just as valid as any other, and think of all the jokes and gags you can have with a SINGING SPIDER-MAN!


Thank you

summary: At the theater, we had a giveaway for Spiderverse. We were giving away trading cards with character profiles on them. I have a...
body:
At the theater, we had a giveaway for Spiderverse. We were giving away trading cards with character profiles on them. I have a TON of these. Like 80% of them are Gwen, either in ghost-spider costume or school uniform.

I really want to do some kind if craft project with them. Cause otherwise it’s throw them away? And that’s wasteful. But what kind of project should I do??

summary:
steve: I have a bad feelings about this...
peter: what do you mean?
steve: don't you ever get that small voice inside your head...
body:
steve: I have a bad feelings about this…

peter: what do you mean?

steve: don’t you ever get that small voice inside your head telling you something is going to get you in a lot of trouble?

peter: uh, nope.

steve: that… that explains a lot…
